TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE in GPE . She currently lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant is the owner of a flat in ORG where she lived until DATE , when she left for GPE to join her son . Later on both of them went to GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Temporary Takeover and Managing of LAW ( “ LAW ” ) entered into force . It provided that property belonging to persons who had left GPE after DATE was to be taken into the care of , and controlled , by the ORG . It also authorised local authorities ( takeover commissions ) to temporarily accommodate other persons in such property .
CARDINAL . After realising that her flat had been occupied by third persons , on DATE the applicant brought a civil action against a certain family U. in ORG ( PERSON ) seeking their eviction .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Commission for Temporary Takeover and Use of Property of GPE ( PERSON za privremeno preuzimanje i korištenje imovine PERSON – “ the Takeover Commission ” ) issued a decision authorising a certain PERSON to use the applicant 's flat temporarily .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG invited the applicant to designate the proper respondent . On DATE the applicant did so by designating PERSON as the respondent .
CARDINAL . On DATE the respondent submitted to ORG the decision of ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE ORG adopted the Programme for ORG ( “ the Programme for Return ” ) , regulating the principles for their return and repossession of their property .

CARDINAL . In DATE LAW of LAW ( “ LAW ” ) entered into force . It incorporated and gave legal force to the provisions of ORG providing that those persons , whose property had during their absence from GPE been given for accommodation of others , had to apply for repossession of their property with the competent local authorities – the housing commissions .

CARDINAL . At the hearing held on DATE the court enquired with ORG GPE ( PERSON – “ the ORG ” ) whether it had set aside ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE ORG replied to the court in the negative .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the applicant 's action inadmissible for lack of jurisdiction . The court found that LAW was lex specialis in relation to LAW and Other Rights In PERSON ( “ the Property Act ” ) . Accordingly , instead of bringing a civil action the applicant should have applied for repossession of her property to the competent housing commission , as provided by LAW .
CARDINAL . As neither party appealed against the decision , it became final on DATE . On DATE the applicant applied for repossession of her property to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to set aside ORG decision by which ORG had obtained the right to use the applicant 's property . It also ordered PERSON to vacate the flat within DATE . PERSON unsuccessfully appealed against that decision to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a warrant ordering PERSON to vacate the flat within DATE following the receipt of the warrant and indicated that otherwise it would bring a civil action against him in the competent municipal court .
CARDINAL . M.V. failed to comply with that warrant . However , ORG brought no action against him .

CARDINAL . On DATE the LAW to LAW ( “ the DATE Amendments ” ) entered into force . They transferred the jurisdiction in the matter from the housing commissions ( which were abolished ) to ORG , Reconstruction and Construction ( ORG radove , obnovu i graditeljstvo – “ the Ministry ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Ministry invited the applicant to contact its competent regional office in order to repossess her flat and/or receive compensation for the prolonged inability to use it , in accordance with DATE Amendments .

CARDINAL . DATE the Ministry issued a decision by which it established that ORG had a right to housing which was to be satisfied by providing him with construction material , in line with LAW . Pursuant to that decision PERSON was obliged to vacate the flat within DATE of the final shipment of the construction material . The date on which ORG received the final shipment is unknown .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant contacted the ORG and requested compensation . She also reiterated her request for repossession .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG made an offer for a settlement according to which the ORG was to pay compensation to the applicant . However , the applicant declined the offer as unsatisfactory . She submitted that the amount of compensation offered had covered only the period from DATE . Moreover , the compensation had amounted to CARDINAL NORP kunas ( HRK ) per month while the amount of the rent for the flat of that size ( CARDINAL m² ) should have been assessed at HRK CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE PERSON delivered the flat to ORG and the applicant repossessed it on DATE . She submitted that the flat had been looted and rendered uninhabitable .
CARDINAL . LAW ( Zakon o privremenom preuzimanju i upravljanju određenom imovinom , ORG nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) in its relevant part provided as follows :
Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provided that property belonging to persons who had left GPE after DATE , was to be taken into the care of , and controlled , by the ORG .

Section CARDINAL , inter alia , authorised the takeover commissions to entrust the property under LAW for temporary use by refugees , displaced persons or persons whose property had been destroyed in the war .

Section CARDINAL obliged temporary occupants to use the property with the care of a prudent administrator ( bonus paterfamilias ) and prohibited them from selling it or from creating any charges on such property .
CARDINAL . LAW ( Zakon o vlasništvu i drugim stvarnim pravima , ORG nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL and PERSON ) in its relevant part provides as follows :
Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) entitles the owner of property to recover it from anyone who possesses it .
Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that the possessor may refuse to deliver the property to its owner if he is entitled to retain possession of it ( i.e. if he has a right of possession ) .

Section CARDINAL ) provides that a bona fide possessor , who is not actually entitled to possess the property , must deliver it to its owner but is not obliged to compensate the owner for its use , the benefit derived from it , or the damage resulting from its loss or deterioration .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Programme for Return ( Program povratka i zbrinjavanja prognanika , izbjeglica i raseljenih osoba , Official Gazette no . GPE ) provided as follows :

“ Persons with NORP [ citizenship ] documents who are owners of property in GPE in which other persons are temporarily accommodated may apply to the municipal housing commission and seek repossession of their property . The commission shall inform the owner within DATE about the status of his property . Relying on proof of ownership , the commission shall set aside any previous decision allowing the temporary accommodation of other persons and order the temporary occupant to vacate the LOC . The commission shall serve a written decision on the owner and on the temporary occupant within DATE . The decision shall contain a time - limit for eviction and an offer of alternative accommodation for the temporary occupant in a house or flat under state ownership .

If a temporary occupant fails to vacate the LOC within the fixed time - limit , the commission shall institute eviction proceedings in the competent municipal court within DATE . The court shall apply the provisions concerning summary procedure in civil matters . The court 's decision shall be immediately enforceable . An appeal shall not interfere with the enforcement proceedings or the repossession of the property by the owner . ”

Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL ) of LAW ( Zakon o prestanku važenja PERSON o privremenom preuzimanju i upravljanu određenom imovinom , Official PERSON no . DATE ) provided that the Programme for Return applied to proceedings concerning the temporary use , management and control of the property of persons who had left GPE and that such proceedings were to be conducted by housing commissions in the first instance and by municipal courts in the second instance . They were required to apply LAW .

CARDINAL . Sections CARDINAL , DATE and QUANTITY on Areas of Special State Concern ( Zakon o područjima od posebne državne skrbi , ORG nos . CARDINAL , ORG ( errata ) , DATE , CARDINAL , QUANTITY ( errata ) , PERSON , PERSON , CARDINAL , CARDINAL ( consolidated text ) , DATE ) , as amended by LAW , provide that a temporary occupant has a right to housing .

Section CARDINAL ) provides that a temporary occupant whose right to housing is to be satisfied by providing him with construction material , must vacate the house or flat entrusted for his temporary use within DATE of the final shipment of such material .

Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provides that if a temporary occupant fails to observe the above time - limit , the ORG Attorney will , within DATE following the expiry of the time - limit , institute civil proceedings for his eviction .

Section PERSON ) provides that , regardless of whether the ORG Attorney has brought a civil action for eviction , the owner has an independent right to bring such an action for the protection of his ownership .

Section CARDINAL provides that the Ministry shall pay compensation for the damage sustained by an owner who applied for repossession of his or her property prior to DATE but to whom the property was not returned by DATE .

CARDINAL . The Decision on the Level of Compensation Due to Owners for Damage Sustained ( ORG o visini naknade vlasnicima za pretrpljenu štetu , ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) establishes the amount of that compensation at CARDINAL NORP kunas ( HRK ) per square metre .

CARDINAL . In a series of decisions ( for example , in cases nos . LAW of DATE , CARDINAL of DATE and CARDINAL of DATE ) , starting with decision no . RevCARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE ORG interpreted the relationship between LAW and LAW as follows :

“ The jurisdiction to decide on an owner 's application for repossession conferred on the administrative authorities LAW does not exclude ordinary court jurisdiction in such matters under LAW . Therefore , a civil action for repossession , based on section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW and brought in a court against a temporary occupant by an owner whose property had been taken over under LAW , should be decided on its merits rather than declared inadmissible for lack of jurisdiction . ”
CARDINAL . In its decisions ORG . LAW and RevCARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE ORG gave further interpretation of the relationship between LAW and LAW as well as of ORG :

“ The temporary occupant 's right to use the owner 's property does not cease merely for the reason that a housing commission has set aside the decision allowing him or her to do so . This is because the duty to return the property to its owner is conditional upon the duty of the ORG to provide alternative accommodation for the temporary occupant .

It follows that the temporary occupant is not obliged to compensate the owner for the use of his or her property since , before being provided with alternative accommodation , he or she remains a bona fide possessor . ”
